intro: Platanthera carducciana, commonly known as the Italian twayblade, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces fragrant, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a spike. It is native to Europe and is often found in moist, calcareous grasslands and woodlands. Platanthera carducciana relies on specific mycorrhizal fungi for nutrient uptake, highlighting its ecological interdependence.
